intro: Oreobolus ambiguus, commonly known as the sandspurry, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are typically pink or red, bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting various pollinators. Oreobolus ambiguus is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
